title: smarta-saw-dah pod crashes frequently
content:
The smarta-saw-dah pod crashes frequently.

Cause

The memory of the smarta-saw-dah pod isn't enough.

Solution

Check memory usage

Method 1

  1. Log in to the control plane node as root user.
  2. Run the following command to check how many memory is in use by the smarta-saw-dah pod: 
    kubectl top po -n itsma-a4iax |grep smarta

    Here is an example:

  3. Check whether the memory value exceeds the limit: (2G)*80% =1638Mi=1.6G
    If the memory on the smarta-saw-dah pod exceeds 1.6G, update the memory value from 2G to 4G.

Method 2

  1. Log in to the control plane node as root user.
  2. Run the following command to identify which worker node is in use for the smarta-saw-dah pod: 
    kubectl get pods -n itsma-a4iax -o wide |grep smarta

    Here is an example:

  3. Download SMA Operation Tookit tool, and run the check_resources.py python check resource script.
    Here is an example:
  4. If the memory on the worker node for the smarta-saw-dah pod exceeds 80% of the total memory, update the memory value from 2G to 4G.

Update the memory value 

  1. Run the command to update the memory value from 2G to 4G: 
    kubectl edit sts smarta-saw-dah -n itsma-fb9py

    Here is an example:

  2. After update, saw DAH pods will restart.
  3. After saw DAH pods are ready, you can double check if saw DAH memory is updated to 4G by running the following command: 
    kubectl describe pod smarta-saw-dah-0 -n itsma-a4iax

    Here is an example:
